title: The Portrait of a Lady - underlying paradox

content.question: Which of the following statements best captures an underlying paradox of the passage?

choices.label: In spite of the narrator’s detailed treatment of Mrs. Touchett’s character, her motives remain largely unreadable.
The narrator’s justification of Mrs. Touchett’s actions is undermined by digressions that highlight her faults.
The narrator’s analysis of Mrs. Touchett’s character reveals more about the narrator’s class prejudices than it does about Mrs. Touchett.
The narrator’s indignation at Mrs. Touchett seems inconsistent with the lighthearted manner in which Mr. Touchett’s situation is treated.

content.answer: In spite of the narrator’s detailed treatment of Mrs. Touchett’s character, her motives remain largely unreadable.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain the function of contrasts within a text.
